name: nytimes
text: RT @llerer: Don't know how you'll watch two simultaneous town halls? Follow along with our chat and you won't miss a thing! @maggieNYT @tripgabriel @jennymedina @AsteadWesley @grynbaum @NYTnickc @PatriciaMazzei @apoorva_nyc  https://t.co/flE7L4hCig

name: nytimes
text: President Trump’s town hall began with questions about his coronavirus infection and treatment. Follow along here. https://t.co/v9PneFEvNy

name: nytimes
text:
A team of New York Times journalists is fact-checking President Trump and Joe Biden’s dueling town halls tonight.

Follow along live, and find more context and analysis here. https://t.co/rcYJpdkCh6

name: nytimes
text:
Joe Biden said during his town hall that he would take a coronavirus vaccine if one became available by the end of the year. And while he said he’d like to make a vaccine mandatory for Americans, he agreed that he wouldn't be able to do so as president.
https://t.co/EBaBMrkICN https://t.co/wuihwJOfEb

name: nytimes
text: "The split-screen is so jarring here," @llerer writes. Follow along during tonight's town halls in real-time with New York Times journalists. https://t.co/Af7kaPz65z

name: nytimes
text:
While it is true that people are leaving New York City amid the pandemic, President Trump's assertion that it can't be built up again lacks evidence.

We're following both town halls tonight. See all of our fact checks here. https://t.co/rcYJpdkCh6 https://t.co/V5DXs7I5Vk

name: nytimes
text: Read our investigation on President Trump's taxes. https://t.co/oJ5iTSCyxr

name: nytimes
text:
Read our investigation on President Trump's taxes.
https://t.co/gI44VJloQt

name: nytimes
text:
President Trump said he denounced white supremacy in the first debate, but this is misleading. He said he was willing to, but did not say it.

We're following both town halls tonight. See all of our fact checks here. https://t.co/rcYJpdkCh6 https://t.co/vxqk1ma39T

name: nytimes
text: President Trump denied knowing about the conspiracy theory group QAnon in Thursday's town hall — days after tweeting out a discredited claim by the group. https://t.co/slb7T7CBCN

name: nytimes
text:
Joe Biden, during Thursday's town hall, defended the 1994 crime bill, his signature piece of legislation, but said elements of it were not carried out properly by the states. Asked if it was a mistake to support the bill, Biden replied: “Yes, it was.”
https://t.co/L8kYKlTpsc https://t.co/TgPiu0kcqT

name: nytimes
text:
Joe Biden said he would eliminate President Trump's corporate tax cuts, saying the president has reduced the corporate tax rate.

We're following both town halls tonight. See all of our fact checks here. https://t.co/rcYJpdkCh6 https://t.co/PwaLxbGGD5

name: nytimes
text:
Joe Biden said for the first time he would make his position on expanding the size of the Supreme Court clear before Election Day. He also reiterated that he was “not a fan” of the concept.
https://t.co/wH9YWoxVPK

name: nytimes
text: Savannah Guthrie peppered President Trump during Thursday's town hall with a series of quick-paced, conversational questions that managed to put him on the spot and reveal his evasions in a way that few others have managed. https://t.co/lhq3SANuHy

name: nytimes
text:
President Trump's assertion that 85% of mask-wearers get coronavirus is false. The CDC said this interpretation of a recent report is incorrect.

We followed both town halls tonight. See all of our fact checks here. https://t.co/locXrMNxNF https://t.co/u1O4lYm7ck

name: nytimes
text: At dueling town halls, President Trump declined to disavow QAnon and was skeptical of masks, while Joe Biden promised a stance on expanding the Supreme Court. https://t.co/HJv3GGcwSm

name: nytimes
text:
Joe Biden falsely said there were more American troops in Afghanistan now than at the end of the Obama administration. 

We followed both town halls tonight. See all of our fact checks here. https://t.co/locXrMNxNF https://t.co/x6qYQgb7RB

name: nytimes
text:
If you missed Joe Biden's town hall:
— He said he would take a coronavirus vaccine if one became available this year
— He acknowledged that parts of his 1994 crime bill were a "mistake"
— He said he’ll soon have a clear stance court packing
https://t.co/fdNq4A9kzA

name: nytimes
text:
If you missed President Trump's town hall:
— He again claimed he would replace Obamacare without explaining how
— He refused to disavow believers of the conspiracy theorist group QAnon
— He all but conceded that he owed about $400 million to creditors
https://t.co/7k2rpQ7hy2

name: nytimes
text:
President Trump has frequently, baselessly said that no president has done more for Black people than him, and  repeated the claim in Thursday's town hall. Historians  disagree.

We followed both town halls tonight. See all of our fact checks here. https://t.co/locXrMNxNF https://t.co/o3pODpiCKl

name: nytimes
text:
President Trump has frequently, baselessly said that no president has done more for Black people than him, and repeated the claim in Thursday's town hall. Historians disagree.

We followed both town halls tonight. See all of our fact checks here. https://t.co/locXrMNxNF https://t.co/wmL1KYHPlx

name: nytimes
text:
Joe Biden said he would change laws that discriminate against transgender people, in response to a town hall question on the Trump administration’s rollback of transgender rights. He also noted that “too many transgender women of color are being murdered.”
https://t.co/D6Mlg7bQK0

name: nytimes
text: A statue of Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg will be going up in her hometown of Brooklyn. https://t.co/FxGOStNPQb

name: nytimes
text:
President Trump defended his administration's response to the coronavirus in Thursday's town hall. But across the U.S., case numbers continue to rise.

We followed both town halls tonight. See all of our fact checks here. https://t.co/locXrMNxNF https://t.co/1xQbgPVt9I

name: nytimes
text:
A security guard who was arrested in the fatal shooting of a man after a right-wing rally last weekend in Denver will be charged with second-degree murder.
https://t.co/ZxzLbaB0iY

name: nytimes
text: We published a number of fact checks during tonight's town halls. Find them all, with more analysis and context, here. https://t.co/etRkN2DjQa

name: nytimes
text:
Explore the history of New York’s East Village — from Astor Place, to the Strand bookstore, to what used to be CBGB, and Tompkins Square Park —  with @Kimmelman and the author Luc Sante. 
https://t.co/wAnsnsSyh8

name: nytimes
text: "The election may hinge on which type of programming Americans want to spend the next four years watching," @grynbaum and @koblin write. https://t.co/CcXDZuZ8rg

name: nytimes
text:
Sen. Lindsey Graham forced through a motion to advance a panel's vote on Judge Amy Coney Barrett's nomination on Oct. 22, less than two weeks before Election Day.

In doing so, he conceded that President Trump may be in danger of losing.
https://t.co/mboLYE6w5R

name: nytimes
text:
Tech companies have vowed to do more to fight misinformation and foreign interference. We saw this week what “doing more” looks like, our columnist @kevinroose writes.
https://t.co/kOjlCxRBxV

name: nytimes
text:
Intelligence agencies warned President Trump last year that Russia was using Rudy Giuliani as a conduit for disinformation aimed at undermining Joe Biden. Trump shrugged off the warning, officials said.
https://t.co/I1Qwokuz5R

name: nytimes
text:
RT @MikeIsaac: Twitter and Facebook spent 24 hours defending decisions to throttle or block links to the NYPost story.

Amazingly, tonight Twitter changed its stance because of the chilling effect its "hacked materials" policy could have on whistleblowers

w @kateconger

https://t.co/zmdQtC2zuO

name: nytimes
text: She runs the Judicial Crisis Network, working to fill courts with socially conservative judges. Her equally conservative husband runs HHS's Office for Civil Rights. With the looming Supreme Court confirmation, they're accomplishing their "lives' ambitions."https://t.co/0HuOXGC0kR

name: nytimes
text: RT @ByJamesWagner: A Times investigation: who is the man behind the megaphone? “I was trying to speak for baseball fans," said the White Sox fan who is now rooting for the Rays partly because of the Astros. https://t.co/kUSdGjnGfT

name: nytimes
text: “The more people insult Larry on-camera, the more he laughs.” For the 20th anniversary of “Curb Your Enthusiasm,” the show’s special guests weigh in on what it’s like to face off with Larry David. https://t.co/TzlD1xT05B

name: nytimes
text:
RT @smbahr14: "At first, I was in absolute terror being alone onstage for an hourlong monologue, with me facing all my deepest insecurities and projections."

I talked to Jake Gyllenhaal about his first Tony nomination -- and (oops!) made him cry. @nytimestheater https://t.co/XRjgpem3dU

name: nytimes
text: Breaking News: A former Mexican defense minister was arrested in Los Angeles, Mexico said. He faces drug and money-laundering charges, according to a U.S. official. https://t.co/xGYl6yvuVE

name: nytimes
text: President Trump on Thursday cheered the actions of a federal task force that killed Michael Reinoehl, an antifa activist from Portland, Oregon, who had been wanted in the fatal shooting of a far-right Trump supporter. "It took 15 minutes," he said. https://t.co/1TcT4xpsGK

name: nytimes
text:
Cyprus is ending its “golden passport” program — which offers citizenship to wealthy foreign investors — after an undercover investigation by journalists appeared to show officials arranging a passport for a convicted criminal.
https://t.co/LiXFlJ6mQz

name: nytimes
text:
All that glitters is not good.

As major retailers in the U.K. announced they will not use glitter in their single-use Christmas products this year, experts weighed how much the decision would help the environment.
https://t.co/zuSvUFel6a

name: nytimes
text:
Prime Minister Boris Johnson has reached a moment of truth on the two issues that have dominated Britain this year: the pandemic and Brexit negotiations with the E.U. His reluctance to move decisively on either could put lives or livelihoods at risk.
https://t.co/PiLWq4a5lg
